modName: TELDRYN SERO Misc Tweaks - Varied trade dialogue responses
summary: Adds a few more dialogue responses for Teldryn when trading items to reduce repetition. And other stuff.
descriptionHtml:
This mod, first and foremost, adds a few more dialogue responses for Teldryn Sero when trading items with him, to reduce repetition a bit. Now, in addition to his default response   "If it'll help us get moving quicker, sure"   you'll hear:
"Very well."
"You're the boss."
"Sure."

The responses are randomised. The default and "You're the boss" responses have a cooldown of 24 in-game hours.
The new responses are voiced, picked from existing material.

I initially made this mod for myself because I hang out with Teldryn Sero quite a lot as he is my favorite Bethesda follower. I simply wanted to alleviate at least some of the repetition.

Also available as options are a couple of miscellaneous tweaks; a removable helmet and enchanted gear.
In addition, I gave a 3rd Era Glass Sword to Teldryn, although he [color=#f4f4f4]still has the default Elven Sword in his inventory in case you don't like him having the Glass Sword.[/color]


Credits & thanks
Bethesda for Skyrim and its assets.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3186836/?]747823[/url] for the awesome Glass Sword. See the original mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3871/?] here[/url]!


-----------------------------
Options in the files tab
-----------------------------
All of the following options include the 3rd Era Glass Sword given to Teldryn. I also included a simple scabbard to go with it, based on vanilla the Elven one. I tweaked the scabbard's mesh and texture a bit to make it fit the sword.

1st option - Includes the new responses.
2nd option - in addition to the new responses, his helmet can be removed. Note that when you first meet him, he may have his helmet unequipped. You have to remove it from his inventory and give it to him again for him to equip it.
3rd option - in addition to the new responses, his default chitin boots have the strongest Fortify Sneak enchantment and his cuirass the Muffle enchantment.
4th option - combines everything.


---------------
Installation
---------------
Obviously Dragonborn DLC is required.
Place the .BSA and .ESP files inside the game's DATA directory and then enable the mod in the launcher or use a mod manager.


--------------
Techy info
--------------
The scripts included in the mod are just the vanilla scripts that actually make the inventory menu open after the trade dialogue option is selected.
For some reason, each newly added trade response requires its own specific script even if they are all the same.
The actual content of the scripts is NOT altered in any way by me and shouldn't break your game xD ...
author: defunkt
